TopicTitle: How to install mods and mod compability

Articles.Content:
I recently reinstalled Kerbal Space Program to try out the new career mode. I wanted to install a few mods to go with it but when i tried to play the game there seemed to be a ton of bugs and the game was unplayable. I probably messed something up when installing because i have no idea what i'm doing.

How do i install mods?

The mods i was trying to install were:

B9 Aerospace Pack

Chatterer

Deadly Reentry

Engineer Redux

Enhanced Nav Ball

KW Rocketry

MechJeb

SCAN sat

TAC Life Support

Toolbar

I understood that some mods need the "Module Manager" so i tried installing that also, but it's just a .dll-file... 

Are these mods compatible with each other (and the career mode)? Is there any particular install order i should use? Is there any way to install several mods in one go in an easy fashion or do i have to unpack every mod into each directory manually? I am really confused by all this and most of the mods doesn't even come with a readme... If someone could point me in the right direction i'd really appreciate it.

Yes, all of those mods should work together. There's no install order.

How to install addons manually: [http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Addon#Installing_addons](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Addon#Installing_addons)

If you want an automatic mod manager, there's [CKAN](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100067)

Looking at your list, you have two pretty large parts packs: B9 and KW....I would only install one and try playing, then try installing the other after ALL the other mods seem to be working...

All of those mods are pretty popular, and have been around and supported for quite some time, so any incompatabilities have most likely already been found and solved...just make sure to read thru the release thread for each one...I'm pretty sure any incompatibilities that havent been able to be fixed, are most likely listed there. Also, any required dependencies should be listed in each respective release thread.

I've used all those mods together, (except Chatterer & Deadly Reentry), with many others at the same time as well, thru 0.23, 0.24, 0.25, & 0.90, with no specific incompatibility issues...So my first guess is you might be pushinf your system with both those large parts packs, or else maybe something innt installed quite right...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-25T00:21:06Z" title="03/25/2015 12:21  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 25, 2015</time> by Stone Blue**
from where have you installed KSP from? I installed mine off of Steam!

> 
> the game was unplayable.
> B9 Aerospace Pack

You know that you need Active Texture Management as well to avoid memory problems?

> 
> If you want an automatic mod manager, there's [CKAN](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100067)

This is just what i was looking for, thank you!

> 
> So my first guess is you might be pushinf your system with both those large parts packs, or else maybe something innt installed quite right...

Don't think so. My computer is brand new with very good specs. I probably installed something wrong...

> 
> from where have you installed KSP from? I installed mine off of Steam!

Steam as well.

> 
> You know that you need Active Texture Management as well to avoid memory problems?

I did not know that. What does it do? There are several versions in CKAN, how do i know which one to install?

> 
> I did not know that. What does it do? There are several versions in CKAN, how do i know which one to install?

If you're using the 32bit version you should use the basic (not aggressive) x86 version. If your install still uses too much memory you could try the aggressive version instead but that one looks definitely worse.

> 
> If you're using the 32bit version you should use the basic (not aggressive) x86 version. If your install still uses too much memory you could try the aggressive version instead but that one looks definitely worse.

How do i know if i use the 32 or the 64 bit version? My OS is 64 bit and i installed the game trough steam.

Unless you specifically told Steam to launch the Win x64 version (*and you should not*, because it's an unstable mess for most people, and unplayable in career for all people), you will be running the 32bit (x86) version. When running the 32bit version, you are limited to ~3.5GB of ram usage by the process, and Unity's D3D9 client has a bug where it keeps textures shadowed in memory even if told not to, so even if you have 64GB of ram, you'll still crash to desktop if you add too many part packs without taking other steps.

> 
> When running the 32bit version, you are limited to ~3.5GB of ram usage by the process, and Unity's D3D9 client has a bug where it keeps textures shadowed in memory even if told not to, so even if you have 64GB of ram, you'll still crash to desktop if you add too many part packs without taking other steps.

^^This ^^

...I should have qualified my statement to reflect that....I just assume every one knows about the current 4GB RAM limit...lol

The quickest way to tell if maxing out RAM is what is causing KSP to crash, is to open Task Manager before a crash, and leave it open while playing....If KSP, crashes, go to the Performance tab, and look at the graph...See what it peaked at during the crash...if high 3GB's to low 4GB's, it likely hit the RAM limit...

I'm pretty sure you can also open the KSP log, and near the top of the file, it lists current % RAM usage at the time of the crash... Mine usually always says 75% or 76%.... (I am unclear whether that is the percentage of your total installed RAM, or if that is the percentage of the 4GB limit that KSP itself hits...) For me, this is because I only have 6GB total RAM installed...My system crashes with KSP running at/about 3.8-4.1GB (System+KSP+all other processes)...Which is about 75% of my total installed RAM: (4GB of 6GB installed)...

But then it could be KSP's RAM usage alone, of the 4GB limit, since KSP only shows 2.8-3.2GB RAM usage of the 4GB limit...
